website_summaries.verdict: This double-dish heater is made to go on top of a propane tank for better mobility.
pros: Heads tilt to help you direct the heat where needed
Gets hot enough to provide comfort for outdoor settings
Designed to heat up to 1000 square feet
cons: The biggest challenge with this unit tends to be getting the burners to stay lit

customer_reviews.title: Very poor anti tip shut off design
customer_reviews.text: The anti tip shut off valves are designed to shut it off if you tip the unit while heating. Even after you shut the heat off and you move the unit into storage until it is needed again, the anti tip shut off valves kick in and it won't light again. Sorry I bought it. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Golfer

customer_reviews.title: The controls do not work.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it the heater worked great. I have not been able to get both burners to work again. One will start and the other works if you hold the button in but it will not stay lit. So you get one burner for the price of two.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate - Plenty of heat.
customer_reviews.text: It works great even though I bought it used for half price. Easy to light and produce good amount of heat. I actually usually just use one because one is more than enough. You can tilt the head side to side to cover wider area if you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in tee his Dura heat propane heater
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in tee his Dura heat propane heater. Purchased it in December and by the beginning of February this heater was already giving us trouble. It does not stay lit. Peice of junk. Don't waist your money. Buy a Mr. HEATER instead
customer_reviews.author: Teresa T.

customer_reviews.title: ... had single heaters before but these are so much better. We use so we can be outdoors with ...
customer_reviews.text: We had single heaters before but these are so much better. We use so we can be outdoors with guests and keeps a wide area very warm. Adjustable and can get really hot!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this propane heater
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk! It's completely shot after just a couple months of use. Don't waste your money on this propane heater!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs Repair
customer_reviews.text: Only used this a few times and it won't stay lit anymore. Can't seem to get any help from Amazon or supplier. Only 9 months old and used maybe 6 times.
customer_reviews.author: William Steele

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: The right burner, as you face the heater, has never worked. It makes a howling noise and the back of the burner turns bright red, as it is heating up. You have to cut it off before it melts. The left burner works as it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Potter

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about 6 weeks. Neither burner will stay lit. Don’t buy one of these, it’s garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 burner works after 5 uses
customer_reviews.text: After only 5 uses only 1 burner will stay lit! Missed return window by 3 weeks....not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kari F.

customer_reviews.title: It worked good for about 1 year dual burner only one side works
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to get the right side burner to work, sometimes it may light. There is nothing leaking and I take care to keep it in the box when not in use. Not sure what to do.
customer_reviews.author: calvin clark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good product, great price! Unit preformed as stated. I would add an electronic starter for a couple of bucks,
customer_reviews.author: camper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! The first time I used it was ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! The first time I used it was at my kids baseball game when it was raining. It puts out a great amount of heat and easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Broken pieces out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two heaters for cold weather sports. Took one out of the box and wires were everywhere, pieces broken off, and it never could get working. Will probably return the second of the two purchased because of concerns over quality.
customer_reviews.author: JBDEN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent heat source for tailgating! Only issue was wind. It blew out light several times.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The last single burner I had only lasted 2 years before it started to want to melt down thus the 3 star rating. We will see how this one works!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Brock

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for use in the cold weather months when I have to go outside to have a cigar. Very adjustable and keeps me toasty.
customer_reviews.author: E.G. Columbus, OH

customer_reviews.title: Super heaters!
customer_reviews.text: Preheats 3" steel to 225F for welding in 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Carl C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap - Plastic - Not All parts included
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Components are cheap plastic and the connector will not fit a standard (gas grill) propane tank. If you purchase this, you will have to purchase an adapter to make it work. The heat guards fall off and are cheap. You would be better off keeping warm by making a fire with the $ you would spend on this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use, it’s exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Scott Eisenhour

customer_reviews.title: Johnny 5 is ALIVE
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I named my heater Johnny 5 after the robot in Short Circuit. Been able to use Johnny 5 a couple of times. It doesn't seem to like to be on any setting other than off or high, but I haven't had time to determine if it's user or design error yet. Between this & my fire table, I should be able to social distance in my yard throughout the winter (at least on the milder days here in IN!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Watson

customer_reviews.title: We bought it for guests at our Airbnb
customer_reviews.text: Our guests like sitting on the porch even if its cold....but they wanted something to warm them up. This Dura Tank heater fits the bill. its straightforward and easy to use. My propane bottle has a gauge that lets me know when its getting low. And it directs heat like a laser - making sure that its as efficient as is possible with an outside heater. My guests rave about it - and I actually like its minimalist and non adorned nature. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Kept us warm camping
customer_reviews.text: Camping at 8100FT in Death Valley in November with lows in the mid to upper 30s. I love a wood fire but the heat is too unpredictable so I brought this along and it was worth every penny. Kept me toasty warm by the wood fire and its nice to stand next to this and spin around and warm up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry W

customer_reviews.title: You're going to burn yourself lighting it!
customer_reviews.text: Nope. Not worth it. I bought this from Lowe's. The burners "Swivel" about 5* each. The "tilt" function is little more than a loose screw. Adjusting the unit while operational will trigger the safety tip-over switch. The tilt function is so poor it's almost 45* between clicks. Best of all! Look closely at the picture; it doesn't matter what order you manually light the burners, or whether you stand in front or behind, you have to reach across the right burner to hold down the button. It gets hot! And if it's tilted you'll be holding that button forever because the switch cuts off the supply.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Stuart

product_meta.title: Dura Heat Tank TOP Heater, Silver
product_meta.description: TT-30CSA, Dura Heat dual tank top heaters with match light ignition and double burner adds twice the heat for those tricky outdoor spaces, patios, tailgating, ice-fishing, and hunting. The versatile tank top heater is a good low cost solution for extra heat in many outdoor situations. Quiet infrared heat, no electricity, and tough construction. Propane tank not included
feature_bullets: Csa certified safety tip function; independent swivel heads; match light; for outdoor use only
Uses 20 lb. Propane(lp) cylinder; variable output (18k-26k-30k btu's)
No electricity required; wind screen and safety guard
Outdoor/Construction Use -Heating Area: up to 1,000 sq ft
Match light/Independent swivel heads w/ safety tip over

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars84 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
